configuration.name: pollingEnabled
configuration.label: Sync process
configuration.description: If it is enabled, the synchronization process finds periodically contacts created, modified or deleted in the Google Contacts side. Each time that a change is found, the sync process sends an inbound message to the application. Valid values 'enable', 'disable', and with placeholders ('Custom' option).

configuration.name: syncTime
configuration.label: Sync Frequency
configuration.description: Synchronization frequency in minutes. Must be greater than or equal to 5 min.

validation.message: The time must be a valid placeholder or a positive integer greater than or equal to 5 minutes.

configuration.name: config1
configuration.label: Configuration
configuration.value: You will need to configure the credentials in the Google Developer Console: https://console.developers.google.com

configuration.name: config2
configuration.label: Credentials
configuration.value:
Follow these points to generate a new credentials:
  • Access to the Developer Console
  • Create a new project. Copy the 'Project Name' in the configuration form.
  • Access to 'APIs & auth'->'APIs'. Enable the Google Apps APIs->Contacts API
  • Access to 'APIs & auth'->'Consent screen'. Complete the form as you prefer and save it.
  • Access to 'APIs & auth'->'Credentials', then 'Create new Client ID'.
  • Choose what type of client do you want to use. This selection affects only the generated URIs for the 'Javascript Origin' and 'Registered URI' fields. The 'Single Application' option is appropriated for most application but if you want to share the same URIs accross all your SLINGR applications, select 'Multi Application'.
  • Select 'Web application' as 'Application Type' and add your domain as 'Authorized Javascript Origins' (per example 'https://appname.slingrs.io'). Push the 'Create Client ID' button.
  • Copy the 'Client ID', 'Client Secret' and 'Javascript Origin' in the configuration form.
  • Copy the 'Registered URI' value on the Developer Console.

configuration.name: config3

configuration.value: If the custom domains are enabled for the application, it is necessary to register the related 'javascript origin' and 'registered URI' ('https://<custom domain>' and 'https://<custom domain>/callback')
